comment: A man who can think for himself and deals with facts rather than emotions. I found that a lot of my liberal views were not only bad for me, they were bad for anybody and weren't based on the real world. Get ready for some hard truth about yourself.
Great professor. Really encourages you to think for yourself. Read the book and follow along with lectures and you will make an A.

He is an amazing professor! I definitely would take him again. Tests are easy if you show up to class. Right down everything he says. Need to study the notes for the tests. Textbooks are not used much but it may help too.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Difficult in understanding what he wants on his tests. Confusing. I wouldn't take him if I didn't have to.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: His textbook is page after page full of information that he wrote himself. He tells you that he will not test on too specific of items, but the entire test is only 5 identification questions and two essays. You just have to pray that you read about the five items and that you can write enough information to get a good grade. Would not reccomend
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This is a hard class, but you can pass if you like to read. You wont pass if you skip. He's the type of person that thinks he knows everything, so if you can suck it up, you'll be fine. Also you have to write a 10-12 pg. paper on a social change and make sure he agrees with you on the topic. I made that mistake, wont take him again!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: No, just no. He also made a book he wrote himself a mandatory textbook for the class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Tests are 5 identification questions and your choice of 2 out of 3 essay questions. He grades on a curve, but the tests are still very difficult. Don't take his class if you don't want to hear his political views every single day. Read the book before his lecture or else his entire lecture will sound like rambling. I definitely wouldn't recommend.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This guy has to be senile. He doesn't teach the material, he teaches his political views. He goes on long tangents that are irrelevant to the class, insults his students, and discourages in class discussion by being rude to those who disagree with him. He will also make you buy his heavily biased novels instead of a textbook.
The worst person. constantly saying offensive stuff. A poor excuse for a sociologist. Doesn't agree with any other scholars.

Fein is an ultra conservative and is easily one of the worst lecturers at KSU. His classes are nothing but him talking about how terrible liberals are and how great conservatives are. There is no class participation at all. Good luck if you take him.

Get ready for loooooonnnnnggggg lectures without any visual aid. TAKE NOTES! Even if your hand feels like it will fall off or your computer might break. If you come to class, listen to him, and regurgitate his opinions on the tests you will pass this class. Don't try to argue with his conservative views, it won't get you anywhere.

Fein is my role model. Despite the fact that Fein is very political, he changed my political views, and turned me into a conservative. His tests are challenging, but not hard. I wish he could teach all my political science courses.

VERY hard tests... and a 10 page long paper make up your final grade. Says he will not test on specifics and details and will only test on high level, big picture content and then does the opposite. You MUST know your stuff to get a decent grade in this class. He was hands down the hardest professor I have ever had.

Fein is an incredibly conservative man with VERY strong viewpoints on the world. All lectures are long with little class interaction. In our class he called Transgendered people "freak shows" which offended several students in class. He didn't care. Avoid at all costs!

Easily the worst professor I have ever had. I share most of his views and still somehow when I write an essay that is in line with his view point, I seem to barely receive a C. Read his book religiously and attended every class and still not learning anything in the class. Too narcissistic for his own good. Avoid at all cost.

Absolutely my favorite teacher at KSU. He is one of a kind - VERY intelligent, speaks from his own personal experiences and doesn't teach out of the textbook. I believe this is much more useful, especially for this course. He is an easy grader, just pay attention, I recommend typing notes. Very personable and respectable.

3 written exams and a 10-12 page research paper, all worth 25% each. Tough class, but possible to get an A if you attend class and study. Don't need textbooks, just come to class and take notes! Fein is conservative; he talks about his views in class. Attendance not mandatory, but if you're between letter grades that will be deciding factor.

I would not recommend freshman students straight outta high school to take him. Just in case you take him, write the important things down. Don't buy the books. As long as you take all his notes, you will be final. WARNING::: Fein dosen't use powepoints or technological things for lecture. Just write write and write

He is one of the smartest people I have ever met. I took him twice and noticed a lot of others did too because people like this professor. The conversation in class is ALWAYS interesting! I always found myself quoting Dr. Fein. He's an awesome Professor! Take him if you want to learn.

Professor Fein did not use any technology which made it hard to keep up with what he was talking about, given how he likes to go off on tangents about his political opinions which he preaches as fact. Sociology is based on theory and Professor Fein does not preface this before he talks about his own personal experiences and opinions.

Everybody else on this site seems to really like him, but this semester it seems like Fein went off the deep end. He WASTED most of the class time just insulting fellow students and ranting on and on about his political opinions (facts for him). Definitely wouldn't recommend him if you have a choice.

If you are not a good note taker, you will have a hard time passing his classes. He doesn't use any type of technology, so you will have to listen and write everything he said. Don't buy his book. I made an A. his exams are not easy, but not difficult.

If you take notes, this class is a breeze. Tests are 6 short answer, 2 essay, but he likes to give points for "getting close." Books aren't required to pass; it's strictly lecture. Only thing I don't like is how often he brings up personal childhood things. Class seems to be 30% actual material, 70% of "now, my parents..." Good professor, though.

If you are planning to take Fein for SOCI 4445, make sure you take good notes, or bring a voice recorder to class. He will spend the entire class time talking and talking and talking. He does not post notes on D2L, so make sure to write good notes. The books are optional. He also requires a term paper. FEIN FOR PRESIDENT 2020!!!!!

Attendance is not mandatory but professor Fein tests strictly on lecture material so go to class every day and take very detailed notes. buying the books is not necessary. 3 essay tests and one 10-12 page paper, but he grades on a curve. highly recommend him! made an A

he's so  conservative and awesome!! but dont worry if you're super liberal he will still let you share your opinions and argue with you in a fun way!! he knows so much about sociology! his test are all essays but he is an easy grader. Just make sure you attend class or get the notes from someone else because the test are based strictly on lectures

Tests are 100% essay.  Attendance is not mandatory, but you can fail a test if you miss one day as that day could be the day he mentions all of the names which will be questioned on the test.  Don't miss a day, memorize all names and what they did, comprehend the main ideas and you should be fine on the tests.  Paper, be specific and write well.

Dr. Fein is a great professor. He is interested in teaching his students the material without moving too quickly, taking consideration into confusion, and always asking if there are any questions. His tests require knowledge. No multiple choice - at all. I'd love to take him again. :)
You will learn alot from him, he is very opinionated but I really liked him. and best of all, no homework! you will learn to appreciate that someday! :) took him for summer!

Warning: He does not use the board or power point for his class lectures.  He can speak and speak which then takes different paths that are related to his family.  NOt clear what is important or not!! When he was asked, he would say everything is importan.  I regret taking him especially for summer.

This was an interesting class but it was difficult! We really didn't read the actual textbook, just a novel about social classes. Dr. Fein is opinionated so if you are easily offended by conservative political views, don't take him.  His tests are mostly essay and he does require one long term paper.  (10 to 12 pages).

Dr. Fein is a very opinionated man. His class is not overly hard but his exams are short answer and essay, which he grades as he sees fit. His paper is 10-12 pages long. if you are looking for easy dont take him. but if you do go to class because he doesnt really use the text book.

Dr. Fein is a great professor! he has strong views and some students may not agree to everything he says but he is very helpful and the class is pretty easy. 3 exams and one paper. I barely read and still got an A. you just have to take notes and show up :)

Dr. Fein's viewpoints are conservative as opposed to other professors and students in the sociology department. I found this crucial to the learning experience, especially when dealing with social class (a hot topic between left and right wingers). It's good to get multiple sides of the story.

I really enjoyed Dr. Fein's class. 3 exams (essay questions and fill in the blank) and one 10 page essay. I learned a lot and although I don't agree with all his views, he is refreshingly different from many of the profs here. He is funny and very nice. As long as you attend/take notes and read the text a bit you'll get a good grade. I got an A.

Excellent professor! He can make any topic interesting with his ability to make it relevant to you through personal experiences and stories. Tests are short answer and essay, but are STRAIGHT from his notes. Attendance is not mandatory, but you would be crazy to miss for this reason. This is my second course with Fein, A's both times!

Dr. Fein is a great teacher. He is very opinionated but so am I so I loved it. If you can prove to him why you are right he will give you points. Don't bother buying the book, I didnt and I made an A. Test questions come straight from his notes.

Very interesting guy. His tests are easy if you take notes during class. You do not need the book. He is conservative in that he likes the market system, but socially liberal. Cool guy! Attendance is not required.

Great professor! Loved the class-- very informative and I learned a lot! I signed up for 2 more of his classes during the summer semester! Definitely recommend him! Don't worry about buying the book. Just come to class and take good notes!

Very enjoyable class. He does straight lecture, but it's never boring. He has fun with the subject matter, and his laugh is hilarious! I am taking him again next semester. Don't need book, but take good notes. Essay style tests and a 10 page paper, not hard if you study and show up for class.
this instructor was WAY OUT in left field....politically speaking as well....his lectures heavily leaned that way....abundant issues...

I had him prior to this class and totally enjoyed it.This class was a little different. I had a hard time following the ideas and figuring out what he wanted us to know for tests.  I have to say I did not enjoy this class as much as the previous one I had with him.

Incredible teacher! Very conservative in his views however. Very smart, he reads all the time and it shows! With Fein it's either hit or mis in terms of liking him. Easy class(s): have taken them all, take notes and you don't need to read books, must be in class everyday or you will be lost. Requires lengthy papers however. Easy grader.

Fein is conservative for a sociologist, which gives him a skeptical, critical, and scientific slant on most things instead of being more theoretical. Course material is important, but seemingly pedestrian if high level courses have been taken before, as with all general education courses. Grades papers leniently and tests on a bell curve.

I really like him. Hated him at first. He talks about sex and feminism ALL the time and it was so awkward but he is really the sweetest man. Two papers and three tests. Thats it. Be super super specific in your papers and read the books and attend class for tests- you'll get an A. Wish i had had my own advice.

Had heard he would be super hard but I found him to be very knowledgeable and right-winged. He likes to talk & even engage in debates w/ the class but his tests were fairly graded (my opinion) as well as the one paper he requires. Found him to be surprisingly a seemingly caring, honest man if you see past his rambling and conservative views.

Dr. Fein is an excellant teacher his class provides great insight on the world around us. Everyone has their views and Dr. Fein is not afraid to express his. If you go in with an open mind and a respect for what others have to say you will do well. He is also an easy grader.... If you take good notes you do not need the book.

Love this guy! i could listen to him all day and I am very disappointed when class is over! Very interesting, not the run of the mill liberal Prof. who thinks he knows everything. I wish they were all like him! Someone said write down everything in class and you will be fine. This is true! I missed one class and felt like I had missed a week.  I wo
Great teacher!!! The best sociology teacher at KSU.

This was the funniest professor i have ever had. He is like most psychologists/sociologists, he's crazy. His class is not hard if you actually go and read what your supposed to read. Its a really interesting, amusing class and i would definitely take him again.

Dr. Fein is awesome! He is not your typical liberal college professor which is a great change of pace since most professors here are super liberal. His class is informative and interesting. He tells the truth and doesn't hold anything back, so if you insist on being politically correct, you might not like him.

Fein is extremely close-minded and believes he is right about ABSOLUTELY everything. Its really annoying. If you can put up with it though dont bother buying a book because everything on the tests can be find in his meticulous lectures. I never looked forward to going to this guy's class.

Prof. Fein is an excellent teacher in this field! He knows what he's talking about and the lectures are interesting, sometimes fun. Some reading is required; the tests include questions on the reading assignments. Two easy papers. Tests are not that difficult. I loved the class!

Very, very good professor. You need to go to class to do well. Take notes on whatever he says, even if its just a side story about himself. Very opinionated. Can be tough. Never used books. I am not a SOC major, but this was a fun, interesting class.
No Comments
Easy. Just go to class, study the notes, don't buy the books.  The tests come straight from the notes.  Great teacher.

I love Dr. Fein!  His tests are hard, and he expects a lot.  However, his lectures are very intresting and you wont be bored.  He doesn't do a test review, and it is all essay, and he looks for keywords and mostly from lectures.
I love Dr Fein!  Great teacher!

Wonderful, Intelligent Prof! Says what other people are afraid to say. If you can't handle the truth, Don't take him. Understands Sociology SO well. Test are a breeze if you understand lectures. Go to class=A. Don't go to class= D

Fein is atypical of sociologists in that he is a wingnut, red-baiting reactionary who isn't afraid to offend women and people of color in class. I have talked to many a person who has exited his class in tears because of his crackpot ****/**** theories. The field of sociology, thankfully, doesn't listen to him. Neither should you.
No Comments

Just like everybody else said...he is the best teacher ever! His lectures are awesome and he really gives a different perspective to alot of things you encounter everyday (race, prejudice, sex, etc). I have learned alot, he really does kick ass.
No Comments
No Comments
He is extroadinarily intelligent, experienced, and just full of knowledge....  has a great sense of humor, yet very professional.
No Comments

He's very fascinating, and his tests are easy, though at first they scare you because they are written tests, so there's no multiple choice or anything like that.  He's my favorite KSU professor of all time.

I loved this class! He is quite entertaining and I actually loved sitting through his lectures. You have to read the material..The tests are based on what you read(sometimes the smallest details) and the in class lectures.

Wonderful Teacher.  Knows he is always right, you will never tell him otherwise, but he is great and fun and his tests are hard but he helps you out when grading.  Coming to class helps out tremendously!  Take good notes and show up.  A's in both for me, looong papers though, but broad topics.

Dr. Fein may be one of the wisest men that you will ever meet.  The only problem is that he knows it, but I do think he tries not to show it too much.  His ideas on race are revolutionary and could change America if people were willing to listen.  Take him!

Very interesting class from a very interesting teacher.  He teaches this class at 8 PM.  After a long day at work I am zonked, but Dr. Fein does a very good job of keeping the energy level up.  Take him if you can.  He is a teacher you will remember forever.
totally awesome teacher! he is a funny jewish man... and he is very fair with grading... and there are 2 essay... and 3 test... I highly recommend this man!!!!!
Fun class, 3 essay tests, 1 research paper (Soci 4490) Lecures lectures lectures, takes attendance. Hes a fun teacher.
